function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Survey data collected from multiple continents and countries, potentially increasing the risk of exposure to contagious diseases during data collection.","Impact":"Potential spread of contagious diseases among survey respondents and data collectors, leading to health risks and potential outbreak.","Mitigation":"Implement strict health and safety protocols for data collection, including use of personal protective equipment, frequent testing, and adherence to local health regulations.","Technologies":"Use of remote data collection technologies, such as online surveys and virtual interviews, to minimize physical contact during data collection.","People":"Survey respondents, data collectors, and anyone involved in data collection activities.","Owner":"Research organizations, survey administrators, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Variation in respondent locations and government directives, including legislation and IT facilities for remote work, may contribute to differing levels of exposure and risk for contagious diseases.","Impact":"Differences in exposure and risk levels among respondents may lead to unequal health outcomes and potential spread of contagious diseases across different regions.","Mitigation":"Provide targeted support and resources to areas with higher risk, including access to healthcare, vaccination, and remote work infrastructure. Promote consistent implementation of health measures across different regions.","Technologies":"Use of telemedicine, remote work tools, and digital health platforms to provide virtual healthcare services and support remote work initiatives.","People":"Respondents in different geographical locations, local government authorities, and healthcare providers.","Owner":"International health organizations, government agencies, and employers."},{"Description":"Close-ended and open-ended survey questions may lead to qualitative and quantitative data collection, potentially capturing complex and diverse perspectives on the impact of contagious diseases in the built environment.","Impact":"Comprehensive understanding of the impact of contagious diseases in the built environment, including nuanced insights and quantitative data on the effects and responses.","Mitigation":"Combine qualitative and quantitative data analysis to capture both detailed narratives and statistical trends. Utilize data visualization and thematic analysis to identify key themes and patterns in the data.","Technologies":"Data analytics tools, visualization software, and qualitative analysis software to analyze and interpret diverse data sources.","People":"Data analysts, researchers, and decision-makers in public health and urban planning.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies, and urban planning organizations."}]}
